definition: evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
virtue has its reward, evil its retribution
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4

definition: Good has its reward and evil has its recompense. The payback is just a matter of time
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4 , ruo4 ran2 bu4 bao4 shi2 chen2 wei4 dao4
containing_words.word: 善有善報，惡有惡報，若然不報時晨未到

sentences.english: One by one, the guilty will pay.
sentences.chinese: 惡有惡報，終將付出代價。

sentences.english: Now it's time for pay back of its evil.
sentences.chinese: 現在是是他們惡有惡報的時候了。

sentences.english: "Well, " the frog said, "I thellos is las toman ah.
sentences.chinese: “唉，”田雞回答說，“我這是惡有惡報呀。

sentences.english: I love seeing arrogant USA get it's comeuppance.
sentences.chinese: 很高興看到美國終於惡有惡報。

definition: virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
to engage in fraudulent activities (idiom)/skulduggery/to hoodwink people/to cheat sb audaciously
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
